matched.actualTitle: Template Inclusion Vulnerability in Error Handler
matched.matchReason: Both findings relate to Jinja2 template vulnerabilities in the error endpoint. The expected SSTI at line 155 (error endpoint) and the actual template inclusion vulnerability both involve unsafe handling of user input in Jinja2 templates. While template inclusion (CWE-98) is technically different from pure SSTI, they are closely related vulnerabilities in the same location - the error handler uses {% include error_type %} with unsanitized user input, which is a form of template injection vulnerability that could lead to information disclosure and potentially RCE depending on available templates.

missed.title: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) in total_loan_payments endpoint
missed.reason: The expected SSTI vulnerability at lines 186-188 in routes.py (total_loan_payments endpoint) was not discovered in the penetration test. Multiple findings related to the total_loan_payments endpoint were reported (negative value acceptance, incorrect calculation logic), but none identified the SSTI vulnerability involving unsafe template rendering. This represents a missed critical vulnerability that could lead to remote code execution.

missed.title: Path Traversal in file operations
missed.reason: The expected path traversal vulnerabilities at lines 106-111 and 147-152 in routes.py were completely missed by the penetration test. No path traversal findings were reported. In fact, one finding (Template Inclusion Vulnerability) explicitly noted that 'path traversal protection is active' and returns HTTP 400 for traversal attempts, suggesting the testers only checked one endpoint. The expected path traversal vulnerabilities in other file operation endpoints were not discovered, representing a significant gap in testing coverage.

extra.title: Business Logic Flaw - Negative Financial Values Accepted in Profile Update
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - This is a legitimate business logic vulnerability allowing negative values for loan_amount, monthly_payment, and loan_term_months fields, which could lead to financial fraud and data integrity issues. Not in expected findings but represents real security risk.

extra.title: Missing Brute Force Protection on Login Endpoint
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Legitimate authentication security issue allowing unlimited password guessing attempts without rate limiting, account lockout, or CAPTCHA. Represents real attack vector for credential compromise.

extra.title: Parameter Tampering on Financial Data - Loan Amount Manipulation
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Related to the negative values finding but focuses on parameter tampering aspect. Users can arbitrarily modify financial obligations without authorization checks. Legitimate broken access control vulnerability.

extra.title: Exposed Test Credentials in HTML Comments
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Critical information disclosure with test:test credentials visible in HTML comments, providing direct authentication bypass. High-impact vulnerability that should be remediated immediately.

extra.title: Business Logic Flaw - Negative Values Accepted in Loan Calculation API
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Business logic vulnerability in the calculation API allowing negative values for financial parameters, producing invalid results. Different from the negative values in profile update.

extra.title: Missing Secure and SameSite Flags on Session Cookie
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Session cookies lack Secure flag and SameSite attribute, exposing the application to man-in-the-middle attacks and CSRF. Legitimate security misconfiguration.

extra.title: Directory Listing Enabled on Static Assets Directory
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Information disclosure through directory listing, though limited impact in current state. Represents security misconfiguration that could worsen if sensitive files are added.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Missing 7 critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, etc.) reduces defense-in-depth. Standard security hardening issue commonly found in web applications.

extra.title: Critical Business Logic Flaw - Loan Calculation Ignores Principal Amount
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Severe business logic flaw where loan calculations completely ignore the principal amount (total = payment Ã— term only). Could lead to massive financial misrepresentation and regulatory violations.

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on Profile Update Endpoint
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Missing CSRF protection allows attackers to forge profile update requests including financial data manipulation. Legitimate broken access control vulnerability with working POC demonstrated.

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on Profile Update
extra.assessment: Duplicate of previous CSRF finding - appears to be reported twice in different files with slightly different severity ratings. Same vulnerability documented with different emphasis.

extra.title: Directory Listing Enabled on Static Resources
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - More comprehensive than the earlier directory listing finding, includes exposure of template files in /static/templates/ which should never be served as static assets. Critical information disclosure of application logic.

extra.title: Session Not Invalidated on Logout - Session Hijacking Risk
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Sessions remain valid after logout due to stateless Flask signed cookies, allowing session replay attacks. Legitimate session management vulnerability with demonstrated POC.

extra.title: Information Disclosure via HTTP 403 Response for Protected Files
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - File existence enumeration through different HTTP status codes (403 vs 404). Minor information disclosure that aids reconnaissance but low direct impact.
